13 // These directives are used for determining what platform this code is being
14 // compiled for. While it may look at little strange that they are initially
15 // defined and then undefined again if they are not valid: this is done solely
16 // so correct Doxygen docs can be built for the preprocessor no matter what
17 // platform Doxygen is running from.

23 #define CHAOS_OS_WINDOWS
24 // clean up so code can still run as expected

26  #undef CHAOS_OS_WINDOWS
27 #else
28  // need to do this if using windows so we can use std::min and std::max

87 #define CHAOS_DISALLOW_CONSTRUCTION( type_name ) \
88  type_name() = delete; \
89  type_name( const type_name& ) = delete; \
90  void operator=( const type_name& ) = delete

149 #define CHAOS_PRINT_ITERABLE( collection ) \
150  std::cout << "[ "; \
151  for ( auto it = collection.begin(); it != collection.end(); ++it ) \
152  { \
153  std::cout << *it << ", "; \
154  } \
